item.title: Moving Away From Email Lock-in
item.description: I’ve been using gmail since it was an invite only beta. My email address has accumulated so much garbage over the years and finding important emails has become almost as difficult as determining important calls. I recently switched to Protonmail due to privacy concerns with Google’s monopoly on data. I had hoped I could get this under control by just switching important email addresses to this new service and forwarding the rest.

item.title: A Less Than Ideal Way To Do 2-factor
item.description: I have concerns with how Duo does phone two-factor authentication and think we can all learn from the way Google does it. The issue: If a user has their password compromised it’s easy to convince them to authenticate a 2-factor request without doing anything that would set off a red flag.
